composition.name: "Don Eidan Blogh" (2006)
composition.description: Double concerto for clarinet, bassoon and chamber orchestra. Written for clarinet for Robert Walzel and bassoon for Scott Walzel. Premiered at the Utah Arts Festival. Duration: 14 minutes, 30 seconds

composition.name: "Triqueta" (2008)
composition.description: Double concerto for horn, guitar and chamber orchestra. Commissioned for the Southwest Guitar Festival, 2008 for Matthew Dunne, guitar and Michael Gast on horn. Duration: 16 minutes

composition.name: "In Just Spring" (1990)
composition.description: Song cycle for soprano voice, piano and string orchestra.

composition.name: "A Glass Box" (1976)
composition.description: Song cycle for soprano, alto and baritone voices with chamber orchestra.

composition.name: "Nalost" (1970)
composition.description: For orchestra

composition.name: "Red Poppy and the Yellow Rose" (2010)
composition.description: Transcription for wind ensemble for Dr. Robert Rustowicz from Clarinet Choir. Commissioned by Guido Six and Claribel, Ostend, Belgium. Duration: 5 minutes 30 seconds

composition.name: "The Image of Dreams" (1994)
composition.description: For wind ensemble. Commissioned by the University of Texas at San Antonio for the Silver Anniversary Convocation. Duration: 4 minutes

composition.name: "The Wite Goddes" (1994)
composition.description: Solo clarinet and wind ensemble. Commissioned by Robert Walzel. Written for Ron Wilkins and the UTSA Wind Ensemble. Duration: 12 minutes

composition.name: "Page From the Natural Light" (1992)
composition.description: Commissioned by Robert Walzel. Duration: 6 minutes

composition.name: "Goodnight to the Old Gods" (1982)
composition.description: Solo trombone and wind ensemble. Commissioned by The College Band Directors Nationa Association. Performed by Calfiornia State University and Long Beach Wind Ensemble at CBDNA Convention in Atlanta, Georgia. Duration: 12 minutes

composition.name: "Satchmo" (2000)
composition.description: For large brass ensemble and percussion. Commissioned by the San Antonio Brass for performance at the Internation Conference on the Brain, UT Health Science Center in San Antonio, Texas.

composition.name: "Festival Celebration" (1997)
composition.description: For brass ensemble. Commissioned for UTSA Commencement, spring 1997. Also availbe for Brass quintet. Duration: 3 minutes

composition.name: "Fanfare and Fugue" (1991)
composition.description: For brass ensemble. Written for UTSA Commencement exercises. Duration: 2 minutes

composition.name: "The Present" (2004)
composition.description: For children's choir, adult choir and piano. Text by Tina Lear. Commissioned by the Children's Chorus of San Antonio for their 20th anniversary. Duration: 5 minutes

composition.name: "Navarro: A Children's Opera" (2011)
composition.description: Children's opera for 12 singers and chamber orchestra. Libretto by Joe Labatt. Commissioned by the Opera Guild of San Antonio. Premiered by UTSA Lyric Opera September 24, 2011. Duration: 45 minutes

composition.name: "What Water Says" (2012)
composition.description: For baritone voice and guitar. Commissioned by David Asbury and Bruce Cain for River of Worlds Project, Library of Congress. Duration: 2 minutes

composition.name: "Liberty Bar" (2010)
composition.description: For two percussionists: Marimba/percussion and Vibraphone/percussion. Commissioned by Sherry Rubins. Duration: 4 minutes 30 seconds

composition.name: "Red Poppy and the Yellow Rose" (2009)
composition.description: Clarinet choir with double clarinet quartets. Commissioned by Guido Six, director of the Claribel Clarinet Choir of the Ostend Conservatory of Music, Ostend, Belgium. Premiered at Texas Music Educators Association Convention February 2010. Duration: 6 minutes

composition.name: "The Ghost of Eric Dolphy" (2010)
composition.description: Commissioned by the Texas Clarinet Consort. Premiered at the International Clarinet Association (ClarinetFest) July 2010. Duration: 6 minutes

composition.name: "Monk, Through a Glass Darkly" (2002)
composition.description: For clarinet sextet. Commissioned by Texas Clarinet Consort for Clarinetfest 2002, Stockholm

composition.name: "A Toot in Ninesia" (1996)
composition.description: For clarinet sextet. Published by Cimarron Music. Commissioned by the Texas Clarinet Consort for ClarinetFest 1996, Paris, France. Duration: 6 minutes

composition.name: "3 Spirituals" (1999)
composition.description: For clarinet sextet. Commissioned by the Texas Clarinet Consort for ClarinetFest 2000, Ostende, Belgium. Duration: 5 minutes

composition.name: "Nine Wild Exotic Dances" (1999)
composition.description: For clarinet and piano. Commissioned by Robert Walzel for ClarinetFest 1999, Ostende, Belgium. Duration: 18 minutes

composition.name: "March, Strathspey and Reel" (2003)
composition.description: For clarinet and piano. Commissioned by The Barlow Endowment for ClarinetFest 2003 Salt Lake City, Utah. Premiered by Jaren Hinckley. Duration: 8 minutes

composition.name: "The Charlie Effect" (2004)
composition.description: For clarient, bass clarinet and piano. Commissioned by Elizabeth Crawford Kilpatrick for ClarinetFest 2004 Washington D.C. Duration: 5 minutes

composition.name: "Line Drawings" (2007)
composition.description: For clarinet and marimba: Commissioned for International Clarinet Society Convention.

composition.name: "In A Bright Room" (1991)
composition.description: Published by Cimarron Music for clarinet and bassoon. Commissioned by Robert Walzel (clarinet) and Scott Walzel (bassoon). Duration: 4 minutes

composition.name: "Devil's Advice to Story-Tellers" (1986)
composition.description: Solo unaccompanied clarinet(s). Commissioned by Robert Walzel for doctor recital, UNT. Duration: 8 minutes

composition.name: "The Graham Trio" (1978)
composition.description: For clarinet, cello and piano. Written for R. Douglas Graham, clariet (University of South Carolina).

composition.name: "Piano Sonata No. 1" (1995)
composition.description: For solo piano. Written for Roger Steptoe. Premiered at American Landmark Festival Performances at Central Presbyterian Church, Manhattan, New York and Smith Opera House, Geneva, New York.

composition.name: "Piano Sonata No. 2" (2006)
composition.description: For solo piano. Written for Kasandra Keeling in memory of Kathy Hodges, Reed Holmes and J.K. Hodges. Duration: 8 minutes

composition.name: "Les Quatre Coins" (2005)
composition.description: For flute, oboe, cello and piano. Commissioned by the Hemisphere Quartet and Ensemble in Roxane, Bergerac, France.

composition.name: "The Three Billy Goats Gruff" (2004)
composition.description: For string quartet and narrator. Commissioned by Cactus Pear Music Festival. Translated into Flemish for performance at Conservatory aan Zee, Ostende, Belgium 2011.

composition.name: "To Be a Puddle" (2001)
composition.description: For cello and piano. Written for Judith Vander Weg and Christine Debus

composition.name: "Out From Behind This Mask" (2000)
composition.description: For baritone voice and string quartet. Commissioned by Timothy Jones and The Cactus Pear Music Festival, Stephanie Sant'Ambrogio, Director.

section.composition:
"The Tempest" (1999) Song cycle for soprano, flute, clarinet, cello and piano. Commissioned by St. Mary's Hall Children's choir, Douglas Boyer, Director.]
$20

composition.name: "Seranata" (1996)
composition.description: For flute, English horn and guitar. Commissioned by the Nova Trio.

composition.name: "Five Spirituals" (1995)
composition.description: For baritone voice and cello. Written for Timothy Jones and Judith Vander Weg.

composition.name: "Prayer and Alleluia" (1995)
composition.description: Published by Southern Music for trumpet and piano. Written for David Balentine and Laurie Wilson.

composition.name: "A Wiser Man" (1995)
composition.description: For cello and piano. Commissioned by Kathryn Mason Hodges in honor of the 50th birthday of Donald Hodges.

composition.name: "Daughter's Dance" (1994)
composition.description: For string trio. Commissioned by Bruce Balentine for his daughter Bethanna's 16 birthday.

composition.name: "Fantasy After Eric Dolphy" (1992)
composition.description: For soprano saxophone, piano, bass and drums. Written for Morgan King.

composition.name: "Rhapsody on The Simple Things in Life" (1993)
composition.description: For violin, trumpet, piano, bass and drums. Commissioned by Joan Christenson for Musical Offerings.

composition.name: "Frog and the Golden Ball" (1993)
composition.description: For woodwind quintet. Commissioned by The King William Winds through a grant from the City of San Antonio Department of Arts and Cultural affairs. Published by Cimarron Music.

composition.name: "Postcard Songs" (1994)
composition.description: For medium low voice and piano: text by Dean Curtis.

composition.name: "Variations on a Truth" (1976)
composition.description: For electronic tape.

composition.name: "Eclatant" (1975)
composition.description: For horn, percussion and tape. Performed at Electronic Music Plus Festival, West Virginia, and at Royal Academy of Music, London, David Sternbach, horn.

composition.name: "Full Frontal Lobes" (2010)
composition.description: Commissioned by Musical Offerings for Jazz Meets Classical Series. Premiered at the Instituto de Mexico, San Antonio, Texas, April, 2010. Duration: 15 minutes

composition.name: "Pinocchio" (1994)
composition.description: Incidental music and orchestrations for original musical by Douglas Balentine: Summer, 1994. Production at the Point Theater, Ingram, Tx: commissioned by the Hill Country Arts Foundation.

composition.name: "The Tempest" (1983)
composition.description: Seven songs and incidental music: commissioned for production of Shakespeare's The Tempest.

composition.name: "Beowulf" (1978)
composition.description: Electronic tape score. Commissioned for KUT-FM (Austin) radio production of Beowulf.
